content: Is there a possible way to initialize a list with the same boolean value without using loops? For example, how can I create a list of N elements all set to False?

Yes, you can initialize a list with the same boolean value without using loops by utilizing Python's list multiplication feature. Here's how you can create a list of `N` elements all set to `False`:

```python
N = 10  # Replace 10 with the desired number of elements
my_list = [False] * N
```

This will create a list `my_list` with `N` elements, all initialized to `False`.
